meanings.definition: A sudden, brief burst of sound or light.
meanings.sent1: The loud pells of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks created colorful pells in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, the unexpected pells of laughter made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The pells of applause filled the auditorium, showing appreciation.
meanings.sent5: The pells of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.sent1: He pells the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith pells the hot metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: She pells the ball with all her might, sending it flying far away.
meanings.sent4: The boxer pells his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The chef pells the garlic to release its flavor into the dish.

meanings.definition: A spell or period of time.
meanings.sent1: After a busy day, she took a short pells to relax.
meanings.sent2: During the exam, students had a limited pells to complete each section.
meanings.sent3: The magician cast a pells to make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The long pells of rain finally stopped, bringing out the sun.
meanings.sent5: The pells of silence in the library allowed for peaceful studying.
